summary: Completed comprehensive testing of SocialRipple Slack-native employee advocacy platform demo. All core features working perfectly including authentic Slack interface with purple sidebar, three-column layout, bot messages with share functionality, interactive modals, toast notifications, and backend API integration. 100% success rate on both backend and frontend testing.
passed_tests: Backend API root endpoint returns 'SocialRipple API' message
Posts endpoint returns 3 sample posts (job_posting, product_update, company_event)
Share functionality works for all platforms (Twitter, LinkedIn, WhatsApp)
Event tracking works for all actions (like, retweet, reply)
User stats endpoint correctly aggregates MongoDB data
Slack interface loads with authentic purple sidebar (#3F0E40)
Three-column layout: Sidebar (260px), Channel View, Demo Panel (350px)
Channel header shows #company-news with 432 members
Pinned message explaining Please Share bot purpose
3 bot messages display with correct categories and structure
Bot messages show avatar, APP badge, timestamp, intro text, content cards
Action buttons work: Like, Retweet, Reply with toast notifications
Share buttons work: Post to Twitter, Post to LinkedIn, Send to WhatsApp
Share modals open with platform-specific previews and Close/Post buttons
Toast notifications appear: 'Liked!', 'Retweeted!', 'Reply added!', 'Posted to [platform]!'
Sidebar shows: Channels (company-news active, customer-success, sales-team)
Sidebar shows: Direct Messages (Paula, Sakid, William), Apps (Please Share)
Demo panel shows: Example Share Requests (New Content selected, Job Posting, Company Event)
Demo panel shows: Example Engagement Requests (Twitter post selected, LinkedIn post)
Demo panel shows: Your Impact stats (42 total shares, 12 this week, +18% engagement)
Responsive design works on tablet (768x1024) and mobile (390x844)
All interactive elements have proper data-testid attributes
Images load correctly (office image for hiring, dashboard for product update)
Links are functional and properly formatted
Frontend-backend integration works seamlessly
Events tracked correctly in MongoDB database
